_comment: Only showing implemented MCP servers. Unimplemented servers (Jira, Linear, GitLab, Confluence, Google Drive, Trello, Asana, Zendesk, Salesforce) are in _disabled_catalog until implementation is complete.

catalog.name: GitHub
catalog.description: Access GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, and workflows. Manage code, review PRs, and automate GitHub operations.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: GitHub OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth App Client ID from GitHub Developer Settings

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: GitHub OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth App Client Secret from GitHub Developer Settings

auth_fields.name: redirect_uri
auth_fields.label: Redirect URI
auth_fields.help_text: Must match the redirect URI configured in your GitHub OAuth App

catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to GitHub Settings > Developer settings > OAuth Apps
2. Create a new OAuth App
3. Set the Authorization callback URL
4. Copy the Client ID and generate a Client Secret

catalog.name: Gmail
catalog.description: Access and manage Gmail emails, labels, and messages. Read, organize, and send emails programmatically.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Google Cloud Console

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Google Cloud Console

auth_fields.name: redirect_uri
auth_fields.label: Redirect URI
auth_fields.help_text: Must match the redirect URI configured in your Google Cloud Console OAuth credentials

catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Google Cloud Console
2. Create a new project or select existing
3. Enable Gmail API
4. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (Web application)
5. Add authorized redirect URI
6. Copy Client ID and Client Secret

catalog.name: Google Calendar
catalog.description: Manage Google Calendar events, calendars, and schedules. Create, update, and query calendar events programmatically.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Google Cloud Console. You can reuse the same OAuth credentials as Gmail MCP if already configured.

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Google Cloud Console

auth_fields.name: redirect_uri
auth_fields.label: Redirect URI
auth_fields.help_text: Must match the redirect URI configured in your Google Cloud Console OAuth credentials

catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Google Cloud Console
2. Create a new project or select existing
3. Enable Google Calendar API
4. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (Web application)
5. Add authorized redirect URI
6. Copy Client ID and Client Secret

Note: You can reuse the same OAuth credentials as Gmail MCP if already configured.

catalog.name: Slack
catalog.description: Send messages, manage channels, and automate Slack workflows. Integrate team communication with your tools.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Slack App Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: Client ID from your Slack App credentials

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Slack App Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: Client Secret from your Slack App credentials

auth_fields.name: redirect_uri
auth_fields.label: Redirect URI
auth_fields.help_text: Must match the redirect URI configured in your Slack App OAuth settings

catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Create a Slack App at api.slack.com/apps
2. Configure OAuth & Permissions
3. Add required bot scopes
4. Install app to workspace

catalog.name: Notion
catalog.description: Access Notion pages, databases, and workspaces. Read and write content across your knowledge base.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Notion Integration Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Notion integrations

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Notion Integration Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Notion integrations

auth_fields.name: redirect_uri
auth_fields.label: Redirect URI
auth_fields.help_text: Must match the redirect URI configured in your Notion integration OAuth settings

catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to notion.so/my-integrations
2. Create a new integration
3. Configure capabilities and permissions
4. Get OAuth credentials

_disabled_catalog.name: Jira
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage Jira issues, projects, sprints, and workflows. Create, update, and track tickets across your organization.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Jira OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth 2.0 Client ID from Atlassian Developer Console

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Jira OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth 2.0 Client Secret from Atlassian Developer Console

auth_fields.name: cloud_id
auth_fields.label: Jira Cloud ID
auth_fields.help_text: Your Jira Cloud instance ID

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Atlassian Developer Console
2. Create a new OAuth 2.0 integration
3. Configure scopes and permissions
4. Get your Cloud ID from site admin

_disabled_catalog.name: Linear
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage Linear issues, projects, and roadmaps. Streamline product development and issue tracking.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Linear OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Linear Settings

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Linear OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Linear Settings

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Linear Settings > API
2. Create a new OAuth application
3. Configure redirect URIs
4. Copy credentials

_disabled_catalog.name: GitLab
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage GitLab repositories, merge requests, pipelines, and CI/CD workflows.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: GitLab Application ID
auth_fields.help_text: Application ID from GitLab OAuth settings

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: GitLab Application Secret
auth_fields.help_text: Application Secret from GitLab OAuth settings

auth_fields.name: gitlab_url
auth_fields.label: GitLab Instance URL
auth_fields.help_text: Your GitLab instance URL (use gitlab.com for cloud)

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to GitLab User Settings > Applications
2. Create a new application
3. Select required scopes
4. Save and copy credentials

_disabled_catalog.name: Confluence
_disabled_catalog.description: Create and manage Confluence pages, spaces, and documentation. Collaborate on team knowledge.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Confluence OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Atlassian Developer Console

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Confluence OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Atlassian Developer Console

auth_fields.name: cloud_id
auth_fields.label: Confluence Cloud ID
auth_fields.help_text: Your Confluence Cloud instance ID

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Create OAuth app in Atlassian Developer Console
2. Configure Confluence API scopes
3. Get Cloud ID from admin settings
4. Copy OAuth credentials

_disabled_catalog.name: Google Drive
_disabled_catalog.description: Access Google Drive files, folders, and shared drives. Read, write, and organize documents.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Google Cloud Console

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Google OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Google Cloud Console

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Create project in Google Cloud Console
2. Enable Google Drive API
3. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials
4. Configure consent screen and scopes

_disabled_catalog.name: Trello
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage Trello boards, cards, and lists. Organize projects with visual task management.

auth_fields.name: api_key
auth_fields.label: Trello API Key
auth_fields.help_text: Get your API key from trello.com/app-key

auth_fields.name: api_token
auth_fields.label: Trello API Token
auth_fields.help_text: Generate a token from trello.com/app-key

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to trello.com/app-key
2. Copy your API Key
3. Generate a Token with appropriate permissions
4. Store both securely

_disabled_catalog.name: Asana
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage Asana tasks, projects, and workflows. Coordinate team work and track progress.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Asana OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Asana App Console

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Asana OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Asana App Console

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Create app in Asana Developer Console
2. Configure OAuth redirect URLs
3. Copy Client ID and Secret
4. Request necessary scopes

_disabled_catalog.name: Zendesk
_disabled_catalog.description: Manage Zendesk tickets, customer support, and help desk operations.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Zendesk OAuth Client ID
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client ID from Zendesk Admin

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Zendesk OAuth Client Secret
auth_fields.help_text: OAuth Client Secret from Zendesk Admin

auth_fields.name: subdomain
auth_fields.label: Zendesk Subdomain
auth_fields.help_text: Your Zendesk subdomain (yourcompany.zendesk.com)

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Go to Zendesk Admin > Channels > API
2. Create OAuth client
3. Configure redirect URLs
4. Copy credentials

_disabled_catalog.name: Salesforce
_disabled_catalog.description: Access Salesforce CRM data, manage leads, opportunities, and customer relationships.

auth_fields.name: client_id
auth_fields.label: Salesforce Consumer Key
auth_fields.help_text: Consumer Key from Connected App

auth_fields.name: client_secret
auth_fields.label: Salesforce Consumer Secret
auth_fields.help_text: Consumer Secret from Connected App

auth_fields.name: instance_url
auth_fields.label: Salesforce Instance URL
auth_fields.help_text: Your Salesforce instance URL

_disabled_catalog.setup_instructions:
1. Create Connected App in Salesforce Setup
2. Enable OAuth settings
3. Configure OAuth scopes
4. Get Consumer Key and Secret
